sub_title: Patent Examiner presso European Patent Office
summary:
- Electronic engineer specialized in physics of semiconductors, organic electronics and printed electronics.

- Academy background: electronics for biomedical applications, physics of semiconductors, power MOSFETs.

- PhD: organic electronics, inkjet printing, fabrication of OFETs for sensing application, fabrication of memory elements.

- Post doctoral activity at JRC: characterization and modelling of organic photovoltaic modules under ageing conditions.

- Advanced esearcher at Eurecat, printed electronics unit: digital printing, fabrication and characterization of printed temperature sensors and heaters, hybrid electronics.

- Current position: Patent Examiner at the European Patent Office

- Skills: team working, reliability, punctuality by deadlines, project managing, data reporting.

school.name: Alma Mater Studiorum – Università di Bologna

projects.title: ML2
projects.description: ML2 - MultiLayer MicroLab will provide a design and manufacturing platform for the production of sophisticated devices which combine microfluidics, optics and microelectronics. ML2 devices will be compact devices with increased performance at lower prices while providing higher sensitivity compared to existing MNBS. The packaging method and fully automated production will lead to higher reproducibility, increased integration of bioactive components and higher intelligence of the devices.

contributors.headline: Patent Examiner presso European Patent Office
Director - Functional Printing & Embedded Devices Unit - Eurecat Technology Centre

projects.title: HYMEC
projects.description:
The objectives of the project "Hybrid organic/inorganic memory elements for integration of electronic and photonic circuitry" (HYMEC) are:
• Reveal the fundamental mechanisms for information storage and addressing in non-volatile memory elements based on metal nanoparticles in conjugated organic matrices.
• Expand the functionality of hybrid memory elements by including optical addressing.
• Develop cost-efficient fabrication routes of hybrid memory elements ranging from micro- to nanoscales.
• Demonstrate fully functional electrically and optically addressable hybrid memory element arrays, including integration with other functions.

projects.title: ROBOSKIN
projects.description: The ROBOSKIN project has the goal to develop and demonstrate a range of new robot capabilities based on the tactile feedback provided by a robotic skin from large areas of the robot body. The new capabilities will improve the ability of robots to operate effectively and safely in unconstrained environments and also their ability to communicate and co-operate with each other and with humans. One side of the ROBOSKIN project focuses on the investigation of methods and technologies enabling the implementation of skin sensors that can be used with existing robots. The other side of the project develops new structures for representing and integrating tactile data with existing cognitive architectures in order to support skin-based cognition, behaviour and communication.

profile_positions.description: Alberto Loi got his Ph.D. degree at University of Cagliari. His research interests include inkjet printing of organic materials, fabrication and characterization of organic field effect transistors and organic diodes, and fabrication and characterization of mechanical sensors and sensing systems based on organic devices.
